page.title: 06EDUCATION:CHERRY WILLINGHAM
page.content: A typical school day starts off at 8 o'clock, if you don't have to do a paper round. After getting dressed its into the kitchen for breakfast for those who don't watch T.V. (and 50% don't). If you don't catch the school bus things are not so bad but the buses leave between 8 o'clock and 8.20am. So they have to rush a bit. The bus people (10%) arrive about 8.30am. with the 'locals' arriving at school about 8.50am. After assembly the work begins with 8 lessons - usually arranged in doubles -. There is a break in the morning but not in the afternoon. Maths and English take up more time than other subjects and we're glad when its 3.45pm. We still have meals provided on the premises but the junior schools do not. Home again we have to do homework before we can go and watch T.V.
